trans-unit.source: Use MapReduce and Curl with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use MapReduce and Curl with Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to remotely run MapReduce jobs with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to remotely run MapReduce jobs with Hadoop on HDInsight using Curl.

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will learn how to use Curl to run MapReduce jobs on a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will learn how to use Curl to run MapReduce jobs on a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Curl is used to demonstrate how you can interact with HDInsight by using raw HTTP requests to run MapReduce jobs.
trans-unit.target: Curl is used to demonstrate how you can interact with HDInsight by using raw HTTP requests to run MapReduce jobs.

trans-unit.source: This works by using the WebHCat REST API (formerly known as Templeton) provided by your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This works by using the WebHCat REST API (formerly known as Templeton) provided by your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but you are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>What you need to know about Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but you are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>What you need to know about Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Hadoop on HDInsight cluster (Linux or Windows-based)
trans-unit.target: A Hadoop on HDInsight cluster (Linux or Windows-based)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Curl</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Curl</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>jq</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>jq</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: When you use Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the HDInsight cluster administrator user name and password.
trans-unit.target: When you use Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the HDInsight cluster administrator user name and password.

trans-unit.source: You must also use the cluster name as part of the URI that is used to send the requests to the server.
trans-unit.target: You must also use the cluster name as part of the URI that is used to send the requests to the server.

trans-unit.source: For the commands in this section, replace USERNAME with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and PASSWORD with the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For the commands in this section, replace USERNAME with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and PASSWORD with the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: The REST API is secured by using [basic access authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basicaccessauthentication).
trans-unit.target: The REST API is secured by using [basic access authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basicaccessauthentication).

trans-unit.source: You should always make requests by using HTTPS to ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.
trans-unit.target: You should always make requests by using HTTPS to ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.

trans-unit.source: From a command-line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: From a command-line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: You should receive a response similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The parameters used in this command are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The parameters used in this command are as follows:

trans-unit.source: -u: Indicates the user name and password used to authenticate the request
trans-unit.target: -u: Indicates the user name and password used to authenticate the request

trans-unit.source: -G: Indicates that this is a GET request
trans-unit.target: -G: Indicates that this is a GET request

trans-unit.source: The beginning of the URI, https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/templeton/v1, is the same for all requests.
trans-unit.target: The beginning of the URI, https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/templeton/v1, is the same for all requests.

trans-unit.source: To submit a MapReduce job, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To submit a MapReduce job, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: The end of the URI (/mapreduce/jar) tells WebHCat that this request will start a MapReduce job from a class in a jar file.
trans-unit.target: The end of the URI (/mapreduce/jar) tells WebHCat that this request will start a MapReduce job from a class in a jar file.

trans-unit.source: The parameters used in this command are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The parameters used in this command are as follows:

trans-unit.source: -d: -G is not used, so the request defaults to the POST method.
trans-unit.target: -d: -G is not used, so the request defaults to the POST method.

trans-unit.source: -d specifies the data values that are sent with the request.
trans-unit.target: -d specifies the data values that are sent with the request.

trans-unit.source: user.name: The user who is running the command
trans-unit.target: user.name: The user who is running the command

trans-unit.source: jar: The location of the jar file that contains class to be ran
trans-unit.target: jar: The location of the jar file that contains class to be ran

trans-unit.source: class: The class that contains the MapReduce logic
trans-unit.target: class: The class that contains the MapReduce logic

trans-unit.source: arg: The arguments to be passed to the MapReduce job; in this case, the input text file and the directory that are used for the output
trans-unit.target: arg: The arguments to be passed to the MapReduce job; in this case, the input text file and the directory that are used for the output

trans-unit.source: This command should return a job ID that can be used to check the status of the job:
trans-unit.target: This command should return a job ID that can be used to check the status of the job:

trans-unit.source: To check the status of the job, use the following command.
trans-unit.target: To check the status of the job, use the following command.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JOBID with the value returned in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Replace the JOBID with the value returned in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the return value was {"id":"job_1415651640909_0026"}, then the JOBID would be job_1415651640909_0026.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the return value was {"id":"job_1415651640909_0026"}, then the JOBID would be job_1415651640909_0026.

trans-unit.source: If the job is complete, the state will be "SUCCEEDED".
trans-unit.target: If the job is complete, the state will be "SUCCEEDED".

trans-unit.source: This Curl request returns a JSON document with information about the job; jq is used to retrieve only the state value.
trans-unit.target: This Curl request returns a JSON document with information about the job; jq is used to retrieve only the state value.

trans-unit.source: When the state of the job has changed to SUCCEEDED, you can retrieve the results of the job from Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: When the state of the job has changed to SUCCEEDED, you can retrieve the results of the job from Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The statusdir parameter that is passed with the query contains the location of the output file; in this case, wasb:///example/curl.
trans-unit.target: The statusdir parameter that is passed with the query contains the location of the output file; in this case, wasb:///example/curl.

trans-unit.source: This address stores the output of the job in the example/curl directory in the default storage container used by your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This address stores the output of the job in the example/curl directory in the default storage container used by your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can list and download these files by using the <linkText>Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can list and download these files by using the <linkText>Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For example, to list files in the example/curl, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: For example, to list files in the example/curl, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: To download a file, use the following:
trans-unit.target: To download a file, use the following:

trans-unit.source: You must specify the storage account name that contains the blob by using the -a and -k parameters, or set the AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY environment variables.
trans-unit.target: You must specify the storage account name that contains the blob by using the -a and -k parameters, or set the AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY environment variables.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>how to upload data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>how to upload data to HDInsight</linkText><title></title> for more information.

trans-unit.source: As demonstrated in this document, you can use raw HTTP request to run, monitor, and view the results of Hive jobs in your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: As demonstrated in this document, you can use raw HTTP request to run, monitor, and view the results of Hive jobs in your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the REST interface that is used in this article, see the <linkText>WebHCat Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the REST interface that is used in this article, see the <linkText>WebHCat Reference</linkText><title></title>.
